website_summaries.verdict: Users love this mattress' unique USB pump for camping and travel. Just make sure it's charged when you need it.
pros: Comfortable air mattress for two or more
Includes USB air pump that inflates and deflates mattress in around 3 minutes
Waterproof PVC bottom with comfortable flocked top
cons: As with most air mattresses, some complain that it loses air
Make sure pump is charged when you need to use it

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service. But whack bed
customer_reviews.text: Received a third replacement finally after only a small handful of uses with the same guest that sleeps over and still deflates. I don't know what's causing the deflate. My friends have the same air mattress but since I bought my own; I have had nothing but issues. Maybe they're using new products to make it with less quality. But it's been only used in the same house and on 1 adult. He's only about 200 lbs max and 6'3. Please refer to the photo attached. But received an extra star for the awesome customer service.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Loses air.
customer_reviews.text: This mattress worked great for a few days. Very comfortable and held air all night. Then we deflated and folded it up. A few days later we needed to use it again, but now it does not hold air overnight. After a couple of hours it is noticeably sagging, and you start sinking into the middle. We had to use it this way for several nights. Other reviewers have noted that this might be because the inflate/deflate dial is not positioned correctly... we tried many different 'Off' positions. Returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: Livens

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Leaked on third use. By fourth use it would not stay inflated for more than three hours. Useless junk, and expensive too. Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: clomp

customer_reviews.title: Flawed - will not stay inflated.
customer_reviews.text: The company has proven very willing to work with me, so I've been through three of these mattresses now. I've finally given up, because every time, within a couple dozen uses, the mattress starts to deflate at night. It quickly gets bad enough that you have to air it up once or twice during the night, or you are sleeping on the floor. According to my son, the inbed inflate mechanism will not stay sealed because it has a design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny C

customer_reviews.title: POP!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a heavy fellow, however, not as heavy as this product is rated for. I slept on this mattress while I waited for a new bed to arrive, 14 days or so. The last time I crawled on to the air mattress, my elbow went straight through one of the reinforcement areas, and the whole thing deflated in seconds. Thank god for Amazon's no fuss replacement of the defective product, or I would be sleeping on the floor more than the two nights it will take for them to get me a new one. If you are a heavy person, this product will not stand up to your using it. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Mattress
customer_reviews.text: Although I bought this for overnight company and not myself, all who have slept on say it is comfortable. It held air for the several days they were here, no leaks detected. Inflates and deflates easy, just flip the switch. Only small con is that it is hard to get back in the original bag, a larger bag would be nice. Also, an air gauge would be nice so you could inflate to the same pressure/firmness each time. But those are all minor, I am happy with mine and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother-it lasted less then 3 weeks, 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Complete crap. It deflated in the middle of the night after the 2nd use in less than 2 weeks. This was used by 1 person, a female, 150 lbs. I had to get up in the middle of the night to add more air. That lasted less than 30 minutes. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: sharkgrl9

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t Stay Inflated
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a gift for our son who was moving into his new apartment. After inflating it, the mattress immediately began to deflate. We tried once again, but had the same results. It was at this point that we noticed small holes everywhere. I have ordered many items through the years from Amazon. Have always been pleased. This is the FIRST time I have ever felt the need to write a review, because of a product that so disappointed me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D. Boss

customer_reviews.title: but our guest said it slept like heaven. Love the height
customer_reviews.text: Have only used this product for two nights, but our guest said it slept like heaven. Love the height, looks more like a bed when made up, than an air mattress. The first night the mattress seemed to stretch and had to add a little more air, but after that it was fine. We gave a great review after our first adult guest. The second time we used this product the air mattress continued to lose air and we could not find the leak. Our first guest was an adult, medium sized, and the mattress was on a carpeted floor. I am returning this product for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: June Clement

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT -- my bed wouldn't inflate and no product support given
customer_reviews.text: i used this ONCE and it went down -- my problem was that I bought it for guests and didn't use it for a few weeks after I bought it -- meaning that the return window had closed AND there was no product support. I did a lot of research before buying this and chose this because of the extremely high product reviews. I contacted product support 3 times to see if there was anything they could do and they didn't even answer. Talk about a disappointing purchase and it was so upsetting to me after the glowing reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn11215

customer_reviews.title: Horrible purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased many air mattresses and this was the first that was NOT as large as it said (not a queen size, my sheets were extremely loose due to 2" missing from width). It would not keep a fill and before I could return it a hole appeared. So bad, that I could hear it. I've had other mattresses eventually leak (couldn't hear) but not within one month of purchase. Horrible, horrible, horrible.
customer_reviews.author: JeanW

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Intentionally spent more on this air mattress hoping it would last. We had a teenager move in with us and needed something until we were able to clear out the room we use as an office and purchase a real bed. The air mattress was great the first three nights, but by the fourth night it already had sprung a leak and became useless. Complete waste of my money!!
customer_reviews.author: Jemachharo

customer_reviews.title: Will it have holes? Coin Toss at best.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with two giant holes. After a few rounds of duck tape, I was able to get this mattress to stay inflated for a few hours during the night before having to refill it with air. Would have been wonderful had it not arrived with holes. This is my second time using this exact mattress! The first was a gift and it, too, had holes in it. I thought I'd give the brand another shot, since the mattress is large and comfortable, but it came with holes again.
customer_reviews.author: Cat M

customer_reviews.title: Constantly Deflates
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping, opened it up when I got there, inflated it, looked great, came back to camp 4 hours later, deflated. Had to sleep down by the switch so every 1 1/2 hour had to re-inflate. Don’t waste you money, get a 3” futon.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Decker

customer_reviews.title: A very convenient extra bed
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable air bed I have used, especially because it’s up above the floor, and has a rim that keeps me in the center. I love the built in electric pump! I wish, however, that it has some sort of handle or grip that allows me to move it when it’s blown up, and a way to secure a fitted bottom sheet and tuck in a blanket. Folding it after it is collapsed wasn’t expecially hard, but it is bulky and for a normal sized person, requires a bit of wrestling to get it in the storage bag. Fortunately, the bag is bigger than the box it was shipped in.
customer_reviews.author: P. Vaux

customer_reviews.title: Quality, comfort and customer service... What a rare commodity!
customer_reviews.text: Downsized so needed a temporary bed for visitors. Ordered this based on the reviews of quality and customer service.. They were right on! Marc from the company contacted us by email within two days of receiving the item to see if we had any problems, then contacted us again in a few more days. We just used it last night for visiting family, expecting to get negative feedback about them having to sleep on an air mattress. They were so impressed with their night's sleep that they had me bookmark it on Amazon so they can order one when they get home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT STAY INFLATED! DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this air mattress for company visiting in late July and they had to REINFLATE MULTIPLE TIMES EACH NIGHT! After 2 nights they ended up staying on couches. We couldn’t find any holes so there must’ve been some small leak in the seams.
customer_reviews.author: seggert

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great support too!
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this mattress, I got it when I moved and used it a few times (loved it) but unfortunately had some leaks. The company took great care of me and replaced it with no hassle. Awesome product, but the company/support is why I'm writing the review!!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary A.

customer_reviews.title: Toxic odor is OVERWHELMING!
customer_reviews.text: This has zero to do with its standard appearance or function.. instead: ***The toxic smelling plastic to this mattress will be overwhelming.. and will seep into clothing and any bedding that has had contact with the bed well after 24 hrs. If you are sleeping inside a closed room in air-conditioning good luck (as this cannot be healthy) This was a terrible experience for my daughter just yesterday. I need to hang this up somewhere and hope it goes away... I'm now spending as much money as I did on the mattress to get the stink out of everything it touched. Ive never had an experience like that before... be warned!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: these did not hold up well
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these mattresses believing at $119.00 apiece I would not have to worry about the problems/discomforts of a low end air mattress. This weekend was the first time we used them "brand new, out of the box and 2 deflated before morning causing great unhappiness and discomfot and 1 held up fairly well. I will be returning all 3 of these air mattresses.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for about 5 days but now after a few ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this air mattress after reading all the positive reviews. I finally moved and started using it this past week. It worked great for about 5 days but now after a few hours it deflates. I have to wake up in the middle of the night multiple times and pump air in it. I expected better considering this was not a cheap air mattress and since the return window has passed I can't do anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It lasted exactly 6 months of light usage. It broke at the seam where the pump is mounted on the mattress. The glue dried out.
customer_reviews.author: Actual Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the good reviews and am very disappointed. Its super uncomfortable despite trying different firmness. The top of the mattress has a rim around the edge that is horrible & the bottom slides around the floor making tucking in sheets impossible. I purchased this 3 months ago & have just now used it. My guests actually moved to the couch. I have no return option because of the time passed. I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Peedees

customer_reviews.title: Inflation issue, deflates significantly over the night
customer_reviews.text: Had 2 issues with this product, am assuming I got a faulty product: 1) While inflating the bed, there is no signal / light indicating that its fully inflated and beyond a certain point just starts deflating, and that deflation cannot be stopped in any way by the control knob, we had to remove the plug, wait for it to deflate a bit, then plug it back in and stop inflation before fully firm. 2) The air leakage overnight was significant, I got a much better experience over the Aerobed air mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Gautam

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money- won’t inflate after year
customer_reviews.text: We had this era mattress for year and a half. We probably only used it a handful of times at most! We went to use it the other day when we needed it and it would not inflate. In my opinion for $120 you can get a much better mattress at Walmart or target. Now it’s in the garbage and we had to buy another that evening!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality air mattress for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mattress. Shipping was incredibly fast. Was packed extremely well & has a nice fabric storage bag! I am so impressed! I just put it in place, plugged it in & turned dial to inflate. Takes just a few minutes. Very nice velour type material on top. We use this occasionally for a relative that stays over. I was told this was more comfortable than his brand name mattress. It also deflates very quickly as well automatically. Easy to fold & put away for next use. Quality product. I had a few questions & Marc from the company was extremely helpful. The price was really great for the quality of the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: didi

customer_reviews.title: which is unfortunate because if it didn't deflate so much over night it would have been really nice. I promptly returned it
customer_reviews.text: First time using it , deflated a significant amount over night. Tried it 2 more times double checking that I followed directions, still deflated. Completely unusable, which is unfortunate because if it didn't deflate so much over night it would have been really nice. I promptly returned it.. thank you amazon
customer_reviews.author: GGNY

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 Days
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mattress to get us through a few days without our regular mattress as we moved. Unfortunately!!! after only 2 nights of regular use, the mattress starts to deflate. I cannot see any visible punctures, rips or tears. It just slowly leaks out air and becomes unusable after about 30 minutes. I woke up 4 separate times in the middle of the night to reinflate and try to make do. I am disappointed that a mattress that is so expensive and so highly reviewed did not meet the basic expectations. I would not recommend buying this mattress as a cheaper option could provide equal or better service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deflating problem
customer_reviews.text: I was using this air mattress in tandem with a Coleman air mattress. What I found out is that Coleman, you can keep inflating and it'll get even thicker. This air mattress have a peak point, and it's not as thick. After a couple of hours of being inflated, it starts to deflate a little bit. After overnight, it's heavily deflated. Next time, stick with a brand name product for air mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Lam V Doan

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware not a real queen size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my last bed that was borrowed and not returned. Wanted to get the same one but shipping was too long. Went with this one and am so sorry I did. It is not as big as listed on Amazon. I bought Amazon basics queen sheets to go on they wrap all the way around and under. Measured the width it is almost 6 inches smaller than stated. Cord for inflating very short. Not firm even when blown up sides collapse with any weight. Very disappointed I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kia Fennell

customer_reviews.title: The swiss cheese of air mattresses
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it out of the box. I opened it inflated it and it had two holes in the mattress. Not willing to give up yet I used the supplied patch kit to patch the holes and get some sleep. It went flat about 3-4 hours into the night. It was returned the next day. Another case of horrible Chinese quality. My advice ; BUY A DIFFERENT AIR MATTRESS.
customer_reviews.author: G  Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Go with another brand
customer_reviews.text: I used this mattress ONCE in room temperature environment, it had 380 pounds on it and started leaking within an hour. No jumping or bouncing just laying. It was a busy month for me and it slipped my mind so now my return window is closed. Customer service absolutely sucks, they were not willing to refund or even replace the product. Maybe it was just defective? I'll never know. Money wasted, Horrible service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than advertised and leaks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mattress and first noticed that our queen was labeled a queen but the size of a full. First few uses the mattress was great - kept air well and comfy. By the fifth use, the leaks started. Of course, it is only on rare occasions that you use the blowup mattress so we are past the wimpy 1 year warranty and now have lots of rubbery plastic to dispose of. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Ross Crew

customer_reviews.title: Deflated on first use!
customer_reviews.text: I carefully researched and after reading Wirecutter and Amazon reviews, purchased this for my 84 year old mother's visit over Thanksgiving. It deflated on her in the middle of the night. It had been right out of the bag. The directions said it could lose some air and to re inflate, which we did for a couple of hours before use. But there was nothing that said it could potentially lose 3/4 of its air in a single night. Extremely disappointing, to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Not really puncture resistant
customer_reviews.text: Chose this product over the King Koil for the "puncture resistant" material. Second time using this matress and it has a small puncture hole. Luckily I was still within the return window and Amazon was happy to refund.
customer_reviews.author: ItzJustinN

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This product is definitely a product you SHOULD NOT BUY!!! It is flimsy, doesn’t inflate properly. The seams fit the coils that you can see on top of the mattress split easily after a couple of months and because of the frocking you can’t repair with the patches they send. Definitely go for the King Koil mattress.
customer_reviews.author: WEMAY3

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is 3 years old, and was used for guests only, for no more than a week at a time, a year or so apart. The mattress developed a hole (perhaps during an interstate move, I just don't know..) that could not be patched, so I called customer service. Even tho the warrantee was expired, Marc sent a new one, free of charge, no questions asked. I will always do biz with this company. Marc was a genuine pleasure to speak and do business with, and the mattress was attractive and comfy.
customer_reviews.author: d. angelino

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while, but now won't stay inflated through the night.
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and was excited about this air mattress. If work great the first couple of uses, but now won't stay inflated through the night. Very disappointed considering the stellar reviews it received, and the higher cost compared to other air mattresses. Next time save your money and go with the cheaper manufacture... You'll get the same quality at a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last
customer_reviews.text: This is my first review ever on Amazon because this air mattress has been so frustrating! We've had this mattress for almost 4 years and use it maybe 3x a year. We've had it replaced once because it would not stay inflated after less than a year. The replacement isn't any better. It can't stay inflated for 24hrs without losing half the air. Very disappointed in this air mattress. I will say the customer service is great as they quickly replaced our first one. Sadly it just hasn't proven to be a reliable air mattress over time. We'll sadly have to purchase a different air mattress for guests.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob & Liz

customer_reviews.title: Looking deformed after just 3 days of use
customer_reviews.text: The mattress inflated well, but a friend slept on it for 3 days, and it developed a bulge in the middle section. Also, while I appreciate the self inlafting option, there doesn't appear to be a way to inflate it by hand at all, which I would like as an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Ronam

customer_reviews.title: Great support, overall great value for money
customer_reviews.text: One of the best air mattresses I've used (used 2 others). Overall quality is good. Weight is par compared to the others. Where this shines is the support - the vertical air columns really work well. Cons: Takes longer to inflate (much more than the standard 4 minutes). Sometimes, the motor shuts off and I have to wait for it to cool down (about 30 minutes) to finish inflating. The power cord is a little short - so, you have to keep an extension cable handy. The sides are a little more unstable since there are no air columns there. So, a bit of a squeeze to accommodate 2 people even though it is queen size.
customer_reviews.author: Arun

customer_reviews.title: Did not last...
customer_reviews.text: Although I purchased this air mattress in 2014, I have only used it twice. On that second use a few days ago it ended up slowly deflating throughout the night. It is apparently leaking out of the seam where the blue meets the gray...I think anyway. Very disappointed, as it was quite pricey for something that I rarely use. Note: I weigh 145 and it was kept in a heated/air conditioned closet inside my home.
customer_reviews.author: ANG

customer_reviews.title: Not well made, seam split after 3 uses with weight under 80lbs each time
customer_reviews.text: This air mattress seems like good quality right out of the box, but the seams split after just 3 uses. The only weight put on this mattress were from a 7 year old sleeping and a 9 year old sleeping. There was zero reason for the seams to split, and the small patch provided with the item to patch any holes will not cover a seam split. VERY dissatisfied & disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: decoRevolution

customer_reviews.title: Deflated after 2nd use  :(
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased 3 airbeds over the past 2 years and each time we spend a little more money in the hopes that one will actually be amazing and work for us when we have guests. The reviews of this bed had me feeling optimistic. This bed was great the first time we used it then, with no explanation, the 2nd time we inflated it, it deflated within an hour. No evidence of a puncture anywhere and it was never near any sharp objects! So disappointed! And the return window has past, so we're basically out of luck.... :(
customer_reviews.author: Ferny

customer_reviews.text: I am pretty disappointed about this mattress. I have only had it for a couple months. It seemed to be working out fine, then out of nowhere, one evening, I find I get woken up to it deflating half the night long! I searched for the culprit as I have no sharp objects on it, no pets, etc etc. But I found a tiny hole on the top part of the mattress. I tried to patch it , it did not work!! That was at this time, my bed! So I am not happy. That should not have happened in just such a short time, or at all! It was comfortable while it worked.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this air bed on amazon almost a year ago I have used it over 100 times. Extremely easy to set up and use, very comfortable! It developed a leak 20 days short of the 1 year warranty, I called amazon they would not replace it. I called the manufacture on a saturday and left a message on the answering machine as they are closed on the weekend. Ten minutes later my phone rang it was the company returning my call, issue resolved he said my new replacement bed would be here Monday or Tuesday. that's what I call customer service!! TAKE A LESSON amazon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: barnyboy

customer_reviews.title: Just buy Intex instead...
customer_reviews.text: Intex is cheaper and better. Buy that. Our intex lasted years. This has a slow leak day 1. Has to be re aired up even before we slept on it the first time. Returning it is so painful due to size of it and packaging not coming with a packing box we likely will just kept it and keep re-airing it up every 8 hrs. Just go with Intex. Same thing. Half the cost. More comfortable. More durable. I’m not often disappointed with purchase like this but super disappointed with this one and with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Worked great till just out of warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the mattress worked great for a year no leaks or issues used 5 times for guests. No has slow leak in it mot sure where it is leaking but could not find any holes in it. Goes flat ny morning. Comfortable mattress though.
customer_reviews.author: vrharley

customer_reviews.title: Leaky bag!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah... description too good to be true. I had a Coleman for 10 years that just died this year. Once I inflated that thing it was good for a month. This new" sound asleep "bed needs daily reinflation even several times a day. Maybe it is the built in pump? I don't know. My other bedvhad an unattached pump and it stayed inflated.
customer_reviews.author: eis

customer_reviews.title: Great product, and a great price
customer_reviews.text: A recent sudden move created a need for a good temporary bed situation. This air mattress is large, easy to inflate and keeps up pretty well through the night. I am about 220lbs and not only did it provide great support, if I woke up in the middle of the night and needed more air I didn't even have to get off of it. Just flipped the pump on and in a few seconds it was back to great and I'd fall back to sleep. It held up great being used every day for a month until my bed arrived, and will now be used for guests when they come visit. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Carter

customer_reviews.title: The motor broke after less than one year
customer_reviews.text: When deflating, the motor didn't switch off after the mattress is deflated. Instead of switching off, which should be a great feature, it required that you watch the mattress intently and turn it off manually. Because it did not have the safety feature, the motor broke during deflation.
customer_reviews.author: MICAH

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Great if you sleeping on the floor with a couple of sheets of rubber in between. We have used this mattress a total of THREE times. The first time it was fine, second time it leaked enough to need to be refilled in the middle of the night. Last night? Completely deflated in four hours. 😡😡😡😡
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: It Deflated the Second night on Us.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this mattress. We brought it to a cottage in Maine to use for our guests. On the second morning we used it we discovered it leaked air and was halfway deflated. I might expect that on a less expensive air mattress but we paid $120.00 for this, and it lasted just one night! It was stored in a room by itself so there was absolutely no possibility of human fault. We are returning it. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bresnahan

customer_reviews.title: A Company that Cares
customer_reviews.text: SoundAsleep provided quite a remarkable customer experience. Almost 18 months ago I purchased a Queen Sized mattresses and enjoyed the sleeping experience. However when re-using it a month or so later, it inexplicably failed. After leaving a poor review, the company tried to contact me but I was travelling overseas. Then out of the blue I received a letter from the founder offering me a brand new mattress - coincidentally just as I needed one. We used it successfully and were very pleased with the care and service SoundAsleep provided.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Collins

customer_reviews.title: If it stayed full of air throughout the night it's worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in May 19' used maybe 6 or 7 times. Man did I have such high expectations for this. 1st night I woke to being swallowed by the mattress. I had to do a top off in the middle of the night. Only to wake up in the morning once again swallowed. If this thing can stay full it would be worth it as the quality of the mattress material is high end. However if I have to suffer with back Pain the next morning and waking up in the middle of the night to top it off its just not a good investment for me. Out $150. FYI I weigh 150lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: An expensive flop x2
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to inflate. It is thick enough to place on the floor and still be able to get up easily. Unfortunately, it was also heat sealed unevenly and quickly developed a leak. We repaired it several times, but finally gave up. At this price, you should get more than a few dozen “sleeps” over it. Thinking that surely this was an isolated flaw, we bought another one. No. Despite being rated for 500 pounds, this one also quickly developed a fatal leak that requires it up be pumped up several times a night.
customer_reviews.author: PKH

customer_reviews.title: Bad bad bad
customer_reviews.text: Deflates contestantly since I bought it. I always vacuum and make sure nothing sharp is around. I would've thought spending this much money wouldve been peace of mind. My cheap 10$ air mattress at least holds air.I've bought this air mattress twice and each time there has been a slow leak for the part where the cord goes in(air compressed engine)
customer_reviews.author: Jomama

customer_reviews.title: Slow leak after three uses
customer_reviews.text: It’s comfortable enough, especially with the addition of a memory foam topper. But after three gentle uses, it now deflates overnight with a slow leak. Too much money for just a few uses. Very disappointed as it was recommended by the Wirecutter, which usually has great suggestions. It may be a problem common to all air mattresses and not just this one. Either way, I don’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Deflated on the very first night
customer_reviews.text: From the first first time I inflated the mattress it has slowly leaked air. There is no visible hole, so nothing I can patch. An hour after inflating it, you can already tell that it's lost some firmness. By the morning it has lost a third to half of the air inside. I gave it two stars because it seems like it would be great if it actually held air. I will be returning this mattress and trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: I received this just about a year ago. I use it outside to enjoy sleeping on the deck during nice weather st my cabin. It was very comfortable at first but then began to warp so now it is basically unusable which is very disappointing. I weigh 15O and hubby is 200 Lbs so that amount of weight shouldn’t have caused this problem. Bummed out because we really enjoyed it while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: Best air mattress in the business
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I was going to have more guests than beds at the Airbnb I booked. Once I got there, I inflated it and it was to be used by a friend of mine who's about 240-250lbs. Not only did it hold shape during the time it was being used, he stated that it was extremely comfortable and didn't find himself tossing and turning. It's easy to inflate, deflate, and store away. This will now be used for when I have guests come to my house! I highly recommend this air mattress!
customer_reviews.author: A. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 years, ordered a new one.
customer_reviews.text: This is my regular bed. I added a 4 inch memory foam to it and it's the most comfortable bed I have used. In the past I've had a futon, a water bed, and a $1000+ mattress. I originally purchased it at the end of June 2016 and this week a seam, near the motor, started to leak air. Rather than fix it, I just ordered a new one. The $1000+ mattress lasted about 15 years. If I replaced this one every 4 years then I would be paying less than $500 over the same time period.
customer_reviews.author: Dd

customer_reviews.title: First mattress lasted all of 4 weeks, but great sales support and 2nd looks fine
customer_reviews.text: Was comfortable & easy to inflate. But after 4 weeks started getting a slow leak. Could not figure out where it was (I used the mattress pretty carefully and weight about 180 lbs). Nearly a year later needed an air mattress again. Bought the 'BAYKA Queen Air Mattress' which started leaking on the first night. I now had TWO leaking air mattresses (and didn't feel like buying a third). Because this one (SoundAsleep) was leaking much slower, contacted sales support (Daniel) who took care of the problem very efficiently. The replacement seems to work perfectly! Now need to return the BAYKA mattress for a refund :(
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: convenient but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Before I moved to a new apartment, I bought this mattress. I found it will be easy for me to take with. Yeah, it’s pretty convenient. Because it’s just a box to take with. It inflated very well. You can’t imagine a box became a queen mattress. I found myself backache after I slept for a night. Because it doesn’t have a support for my waist. It made a little bit noises when I moved on the mattress. I think it would be more comfortable for only one person. I need to input more air serval days. It’s not very soft compares to spring mattress. Even though It doesn’t work for me, my husband likes that.
customer_reviews.author: Polly

customer_reviews.title: This measures 3+ inches smaller than a Queen.....
customer_reviews.text: This air mattress is a size FULL at best, not a queen! It’s much smaller than the Intex brand I bought before. I measured this one after it filled out and stretched and it’s not even close to 60 inches in width. It’s barely 56 inches... not a true queen. Nowhere on the mattress does it say what size it’s supposed to be, so buyer beware! For $119 I expected to get what I thought I was paying for: A QUEEN SIZED MATTRESS! Sorely disappointed in this brand!!!
customer_reviews.author: ART

customer_reviews.title: Poor Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this horrible product. Used this three times, and apparently just happened to miss the return window. A hole developed on the top in a seem on the cloth, making it impossible to repair. If you want to spend $120 to sleep on something 3 times you found it, look no further. Otherwise go to walmart you can find the same thing cheaper and at least they'll give you a 90 day return window on all their items.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great to take to a hotel
customer_reviews.text: My 8yo son and 12yo daughter are too old to sleep together in a hotel at this point. We can do it in a pinch, but it's much better if we get a suite with a pull out and they can decide who sleeps on this awesome mattress. It's lightweight, so even if the outlet isn't where the bed is going, it's no problem. My son has proven it's nearly indestructible, and they both want the mattress over the pullout everywhere we go.
customer_reviews.author: Family of Four

customer_reviews.title: Sizes are fudged. A queen size mattress is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Sizes are fudged. A queen size mattress is a 60x80. This one claims it’s a queen at 58x78 plus or minus 2 inches. (Key disclaimer) it measures exactly 56 x 76....that’s one inch bigger in each direction than what a full is supposed to measure at. Plus box says mattress contains chemicals that cause cancer and reproductive harm. Boxed this POS up and sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W Churchwell

customer_reviews.title: Great air mattress but didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: This is my second of these air mattresses. The first one lasted me awhile when used for a week after moving and then when I had guests come to visit. Once that one stopped holding air after 1.5 years, I ordered the same mattress again. This one only lasted a month before it stopped holding air. I just missed my return window or I would return to the company. It's a comfortable air mattress but it seems like the durability might be hit or miss.
customer_reviews.author: melmoiselle

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: We've owned this product for almost 2 years and have used it intermittently for guests and when we were moving house. The product is very decent and it can easily withstand the weight of 2 grownups (or in our case a bunch of kids who think its a bouncy castle). Unfortunately, the motor was fried when one of my guests plugged it into a 220V outlet - completely our own fault. I contacted customer service to see if there was anything I could do (fully expecting the worst). To my surprize they generously offered to replace the motor as long as I took care of the shipping costs. 2 big thumbs up for good-old customer service!
customer_reviews.author: EndlessFan

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfy as the original Aerobed
customer_reviews.text: I realize that this was a less expensive blow up bed but the independent ratings were extremely high and I also needed it shipped in a hurry. That being said, the mattress inflates & deflates within a reasonable time and you don't have to hold the pump button which is good. It seems very stable, however, it does blow up hard and to make it comfortable for my guests I added a very thick mattress topper(which I had on another bed). Something to think about. It does deflate to a small duffle size and comes with a patch kit.
customer_reviews.author: Hermosasue

customer_reviews.title: We "test inflated" the mattress and all was good. We slept for one night on the mattress ...
customer_reviews.text: We received the product as promised. We "test inflated" the mattress and all was good. We slept for one night on the mattress at our home. We brought the mattress up to our cabin to replace a 6 year old, competitive mattress. The mattress failed to hold complete inflation after only a few minutes. I ended up refilling the mattress 5 times in 3 hours time...we were trying to sleep between inflations... I have yet to try to return the mattress, but will rely on Amazon and SoundAsleep Products to make good on their warranty. We are not happy at this point!
customer_reviews.author: Long Island Bob

customer_reviews.title: The best air mattress in the world.. with even better customer service
customer_reviews.text: Please support this family owned and operated business. The product is very impressive and I regularly refer to it as “the best air mattress in the world”. However, the most impressive part is their customer service. After a year of ownership there was a small pin sized hole in the mattress, within an hour of sending soundasleep an email a replacement air mattress was overnighted to me (note the product was out of warranty). BEST customer service experience I have had in years.. trust when you buy from soundasleep that you are not only getting a world class product but also a product that the manufacturer will stand behind.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable and Very Easy to Inflate/Deflate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I had company coming and needed an extra bed to put in the office. There are other inflatable beds cheaper than this, but I'm glad I spent the extra money. Not only is this bed comfortable, but it is very easy to inflate and deflate. It comes with a drawstring bag for storage so the deflated mattress is easily stored in a closet. If you are in the market for an inflatable mattress, I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: PewPewPew

customer_reviews.title: No waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Had mattress less than a week and after 4 hours of lite use ( a 3 yr old and a 7 yr old sleeping on it) the mattress had leaked so much air that it had to be re-inflated.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Donovan Betz

customer_reviews.title: This mattress kind of sucks... Doesn't stay inflated.
customer_reviews.text: This mattress is easy to inflate but the problem is it doesn't stay inflated after blowing it up. It will deflate on its own after only a few hours. So you have to re-inflate it every few hours which pretty much makes it useless. I have only used this mattress a few times since purchased and this issue has happened every time. I have checked for holes/leaks and have not been able to find any. Look at the other reviews, many people have this same problem. I cannot recommend this air mattress to anyone. This was a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: W2TMachine

customer_reviews.title: Great Service / Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the SoundAsleep Dream Series Air Mattress and were pleasantly surprised by the quick delivery. We used it the very night that it arrived. It was incredibly easy to inflate. We used the mattress as soon as it arrived and found that it only needed a small additional inflating after the second night. The company contacted us within 24 hours of our shipment arriving to make sure that everything was ok. Overall, we are quite pleased with the service and the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Iwersen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable and sturdy air bed. Easy fill with electronic pumping, comfortably sleeps 2 people, and compact enough for easy storage ( when not in use). I found this air bed to be the best among the ones I’ve tried in the past. I used it for 2 weeks for guests and it has worked very well for me. In my opinion the quality of this air bed is excellent and I’m very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Firmness
customer_reviews.text: I have slept on it now for four days in a row. It does inflate easily but wish it had an automatic off when completely full as my last air mattress, not one of yours had one of the internal coils blow and eventually leaked. It has been comfortable, not noisey when turning, has not lost noticeable air during night (just a very slight difference but not appreciative) and very easy to deflate and pack away. Will be using it over the next three weeks so if I change my opinion on anything, will let you know. Overall, chose it from just googling reviews on inflatable beds and so far I would give it a 4-5 star.
customer_reviews.author: TC from SD

customer_reviews.title: Great products! Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased 3 of the queen Dream Series mattresses for our self and both of our daughters. They are extremely comfortable and quick and easy to inflate and deflate. The units have been reliable even with a fair amount of guests using them during visits. Only once have we had a problem with one of the units and the SoundAsleep customer service was OUTSTANDING resolving the problem quickly and to our 100% satisfaction. I would highly recommend them for great products and great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: We use the mattress as an extra sleeping spot in our vacation home. It has been great. Recently it started losing air and I called the company to find out how to patch it. They responded by offering to ship us a replacement bed immediately even though it was outside of warranty. This is the kind of company that I'm happy to recommend to others. Dave
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Snowden

customer_reviews.title: Excellent except one small issue.
customer_reviews.text: My relative sleeping in the bed says the bed is extremely comfortable and was easy to set up. After airing up the first time, it did indeed need to be aired up more as the material stretched. Understandable. It seems as though it needs to aired up a little bit every night. Not much, but needing a little air every night seems to be a bit more than what should be normal.
customer_reviews.author: Roy R

customer_reviews.title: Impressed so far.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this air mattress for occasional use for friends and family. After 3 days of use from a family member they were enthusiastic that it was the best sleep they’ve gotten on an air mattress. The internal pump is way less noisey than my old Coleman pump/mattress, and it has a deflate position as well. It’s very tall, so it’s easy to get off of, holds air, and came with a patch kit, as well as a storage bag. I am impressed enough that we will be purchasing a queen sized mattress as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A McCauley

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts a few uses before losing air
customer_reviews.text: We had high hopes for this mattress, as we’ve gone through many over the years and can never seem to get more than just a few uses out of them before they begin to fail to hold air. We are very cautious with air mattresses because they seem to be fragile. We never let them be used as trampolines by the kids, we take them down when not in use, store them properly, etc, yet we always ding them losing air after only a few uses and this one was no exception. I’m really disappointed. When we first got it, it was very easy to inflate and was very comfortable. Just wish it had lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: KDiaz

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I had this air mattress shipped to my son's home ahead of my visit. It took just minutes to inflate at bed time and I was able to fill it to the firmness I like. The mattress height was perfect as not to feel like I was on the floor. There was no noise or movement of the mattress when I turned or moved. In the morning it was very easy to use the internal motor to deflate and put the mattress away until the next night. I was very pleased with this purchase and now I have my own bed waiting for me at my son's home for the next time I visit the grandkids.
customer_reviews.author: Lisaloo

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed But Slowly Deflates
customer_reviews.text: Update: The leak is very slow and we only have to add air once a week with a grown man sleeping on the mattress. Worth keeping. Much easier to get out of than the 6" mattress ($20 at Walmart) it replaced but doesn't sleep any better (but still comfortable). Problem is that we have to reinflate it every other night because it loses air and it's brand new. I think it is overpriced. I also consider it irresponsible that neither the vendor nor manufacturer is responding to any of the problems voiced in customer reviews. A number of recent reviews have mentioned deflation as a problem with no vendor/manufacturer replys.
customer_reviews.author: Conspicuous ConsumerTop Contributor: Jigsaw Puzzles

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than many regular mattresses.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use temporarily and found that it was more comfortable than many other mattresses I have slept on. I actually used it several months and my back hurt less using it then a foam mattress. Inflates and deflates easily and quickly! Best air mattress I’ve ever had! You can inflate it more or less for your firmness so it’s kind of like a sleep number bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: arguably the best air mattress I've every slept on
customer_reviews.text: This is arguably the best air mattress I have owned. I love that it stays inflated all night and I don't wake up in a pile of sheets in the morning. It stays put and doesn't slide around on carpet. The top layer helps my sheets stay in place as well and so that it does not feel like I am sleeping on plastic. The height also makes this mattress feel more like a real bed. This company has great customer service, returned my call the same day, and has a one year warrenty if there is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tayne

customer_reviews.title: Air Mattress
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this but a week, but it held up through a sleepover with 2 crazy 11 yr olds and an excited 1 & 1/2 yr old. I mean rolling and jumping and body slams and everything you tell your children not to do on an air mattress. I was so upset, I thought my kids were going to destroy it. I was already thinking of punishments, but alas! It survived! This mattress is awesome. It inflates/deflates with ease and the girls slept great. I'll update after a few uses to see how it holds up to extended use, but so far its great.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Great for 1 or 2 nights
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace our cheap Intex mattress that kept deflating. It’s super easy to inflate and deflate and it stays inflated all night. The only caveat is that it doesn’t quite inflate to the ultimate level of firmness I want (I prefer it to be extremely firm). You can tell when it is inflated all the way because the pump will change it’s tone. It takes just minutes to inflate and deflate and it has a little nook in the mattress end to store the cord. It’s no sleep number but it works great for two people for a few nights. It’s 10x more comfortable if one person is sleeping in it alone.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D.

customer_reviews.title: If You Need an Air Mattress, You Won’t Be Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I slept on this air mattress for about 3 weeks after I moved into a new apartment. It was definitely the best air mattress I have ever used and seems very durable. The higher height made it seem a little more like a traditional bed, but sleeping on this is definitely not as comfortable as sleeping on a traditional bed. So while this not a replacement for a regular mattress, if you temporarily need an air mattress for whatever reason you will not be disappointed with the SoundAsleep.
customer_reviews.author: Twindad522

customer_reviews.title: Please don't waste your money on this product
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. Inflated the bed without any problems. It does say it loses air over a period of time. In between the time I set it up and tried to inflate it again, NO ONE had slept on the mattress. When I went to top it off with air, the motor didn't work. I had it on the inflate button and it continued to deflate. I waited and tried again and it did the same thing. I will be returning this and will want a refund. I won't buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great Mattress - Do Not Hesitate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mattress several years ago and forgot how much we liked it. We were having company and dug it out of the basement - it worked perfectly and is extremely comfortable. So, as one of my best long-term purchases, decided to leave this review. We had purchased this several years ago and used it daily while our place was under construction, then it went into storage. This is a great mattress and it is absolutely worth paying the difference over the less durable and much less comfortable competitors, and I have had several. Can not recommend this strongly enough. Do not hesitate - it is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deteriorates Quickly
customer_reviews.text: We have had this mattress for 4 months and used it about 10 times. The first few times it was great. But on the 5th time our guest ended up sleeping on the floor because it deflated. We found 2 small holes in it and patched them. We don’t know how these holes happened, because we store it nicely and when we blow it up we place it in an open space. Then another friend slept on it and woke up on the floor. It seems like the mattress is just poor quality and wears out after just a few uses. Don’t buy this mattress!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and Quick with built in pump!
customer_reviews.text: ordered this mattress to use while waiting for furniture arrive from cross country move. Came in a small-ish box and had a built in pump. From box open to bed fill up, was maybe 6 minutes! Very comfy and held its air/shape easily with 2 people. The plastic smell was a little strong the first night, but hardly noticeable by night 5. I did have to give it 30 second fills on day 2 and 3 (as the directions mentioned I would due to stretching out). While I wouldnt want to sleep on this bed forever, it was certainly comfy enough for 5 days and for occasional visitors! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: B to the P

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a guest bed when my daughter and son-in-law visit. Easy to inflate and deflate.No problems so far. I put a mattress cover on , but it’s not necessary. Also , my daughter puts a blanket of the bed sheet to sleep on. The air is cold in the mattress. Works really well. The king size is great for the two of them and their dog.
customer_reviews.author: Artist1224

customer_reviews.title: Winner Winner ZZZZZZZZZZ
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other brands in the past and have been underwhelmed with their comfort and durability. We selected this one vs. the more automated models that decide when to top off the air for you. I can't see an electric pump turning on in the middle of the night as a good thing. My wife and I spent a week on this Dream Series Queen and can report that inflate and deflate were flawless, no noticeable leakage during the night, and it was very comfortable. Durability and longevity is TBD but for an easy to setup temporary guest mattress this is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: ALF Engineer

customer_reviews.title: So dissapointing!! Lasted one night as fully inflated ...
customer_reviews.text: So dissapointing!! Lasted one night as fully inflated and then, my daughter, who visits us from out of town, found her sleeping on the floor with this "mattress" underneath her three weeks later. Sadly, she visits us only once per month, so we are apparently unable to receive a refund. I guess we need live and learn. We were had. That's retail...
customer_reviews.author: WouldYa

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This mattress is more comfortable than my own bed. Just like the instructions said, you have to add air each day for a few times after continuous sleep due to stretching of the material. The perimeter is softer than the sleeping area so you have to be careful not to sit on the edge. I have slept on this for over a week now and am very satisfied with this mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Moore

customer_reviews.title: When you need an extra mattress this is the one you want
customer_reviews.text: We have used this blow up mattress since 2017 whenever we had guests to our home. It is super easy to inflate with the built in pump and stores in a bag that is included. All our guests rave about how comfortable it is and how they can customize the firmness to their preference. The customer service at SoundAsleep is first rate and they are ready to answer any question you may have. GOOD BUY...GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.author: Alan G.

product_meta.title: SoundAsleep Dream Series Air Mattress with ComfortCoil Technology & Internal High Capacity Pump - Queen Size
feature_bullets: CUSTOMER FRIENDLY 1-YEAR WARRANTY comes standard on all SoundAsleep mattresses. Rest assured on your purchase of the highest quality air mattress money can buy. Call or email anytime for support. Our US based team is here to help!

INDUSTRY LEADING DESIGN exclusively using ComfortCoil Technology and a SureGrip bottom to ensure firmness and stability. No slipping and sliding! With 40 internal air coils for added durability and support your bed will remain flat and firm so you can stay SoundAsleep! Updated in 2019 with our official SoundAsleep logo!

PATENTED 1-CLICK INTERNAL PUMP ensures quick and easy inflation and deflation. Designed for in-home use, the Queen Size Dream Series mattress reaches full inflation in under 4 minutes and will stay inflated for days. If you prefer a firmer surface, use the pump for a quick top up!

PREMIUM “DOUBLE-HEIGHT” RAISED AIR BED with dual chamber construction. With inflated dimensions of 78” x 58” x 19”, this mattress is large enough to sleep two people comfortably or one person like a king! Guests, friends and relatives of all shapes and sizes will be thrilled. For a smaller mattress, check out our Twin Size!
EXTRA THICK, WATERPROOF FLOCKED TOP ensures a comfortable sleeping experience while multilayer, puncture-resistant Eco-Friendly PVC makes this mattress extra durable and long-lasting.
